titleStmt.title: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i rgya cher 'grel ba
titleStmt.author: ar byang chub ye shes

editionStmt.edition: Digital Edition in Wylie with TEI Markup

licence.p: The Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) licence applies to this document.

physDesc.additional: Size assuming the identification as No. 10294 is correct. Script: 'bru tsha. Lines per folio: 9; 3 on fol. 6b. Orthography: - bindu for m - da drags (6b3: pha rol du phyind pa'i) - palatalization of ma - abbreviations (for thams cad, bcu gcig, yon tan, etc.) - Na for med - sanskritized words ('bu' ta for sangs rgyas) - numerals used for numbers - additional prefix b- (e.g., bsgom pa) - superabundant 'a rjes 'jug (e.g., 'di') - vertical ligature for d+ng (looking like rng) - expected ba/bo often written like pa/po Numerous interlinear annotations (some of which corrections) and marginal annotations.

projectDesc.p: This document was created and is made available in the framework of the ERC project â€œThe Dawn of Tibetan Buddhist Scholasticism (11th-13th c.) (TibSchol). This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement No. 101001002). See https://cordis.europa.eu/project/id/101001002

prefixDef.p: In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "db" prefix point to the project's APIS instance, a database system to collect information of entities.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "per" prefix point to the BDRC's data interface's person module.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "zot" prefix point to a record in the projects's Zotero group.
In the context of the TibSchol project, references using the "corpusmd" prefix point to any element in the corpus TEI document via its ID.

body.ab: dags poWe provisionally take "dags po" to refer to Dwags po lha rje, i.e., sGam po pa. Another candidate would be Dwags po dbang rgyal (ID:3792) dang khyung poWe provisionally take "khyung po" to refer to Khyung po grags se. Another candidate would be Khyung po Chos kyi brtson 'grus (ID:5887) ni gha te gha te zhes pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid yin la | pa ra gha te zhes pa ni mtshan ma med pa yin la | pa ra sang gha te zhes pa ni rmon pa myed pa yin no zer ro ||

'brom ltar na tad yA tha zhes pa ni 'di lta ste bya ba yin la | gha te gha te bya ba ni song 1 song 1 bya ba yin pas tshogs laM sbyor laM du song 1 bya ba yin la || pa ra gha te zhes bya ba ni
pha rol du song 1 bya ba yin pas mthong laM du song 1 bya ba yin la | pa ra sang gha te zhes bya ba ni yang dag par song 1 bya ba yin pas | sgoM laM du song 1 bya ba yin la | bho te swo ha zhes bya ba ni byang chub zhi bar song 1 bya ba yin pas mi slob pa'i laM du song 1 bya ba yin zer te legs so ||

'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol du phyind pa'i mdo' rgya cher 'grel pa | gsang phu ba ar zer ro(zer ro)This note is by a different hand than the glosses to the text. shag kya'i dge slong byang chub ye shes kyis sbyar ba'o |||| rdzogs s+h+yo ||||
